workflow.name: Detect and correct claims cost leakage with GPT-4 and automated alerts
workflow.description:
## How It Works
This workflow automates enterprise claims cost leakage detection by identifying overpayments, policy deviations, and pricing inconsistencies across claims data. It supports claims operations, finance, and audit teams by providing continuous, AI-driven monitoring without manual review. Claims data is ingested through parallel HTTP requests, including claim history, policy details, pricing rules, and enrichment data. Historical claim patterns feed calculator-based risk scoring to flag potential leakage scenarios. All data streams are consolidated and analyzed using GPT-4 with structured outputs to detect anomalies, quantify leakage risk, and recommend corrective adjustments. The workflow generates claim-level findings and routes outcomes by severity: high-risk leakage triggers immediate email and Slack alerts, while lower-risk issues are compiled into periodic audit and recovery reports.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure HTTP nodes with competitor website APIs  
2. Add OpenAI API key to Chat Model node for AI analysis  
3. Connect Gmail account and set leadership distribution list  
4. Integrate Slack workspace and configure strategy team  
5. Adjust Schedule node timing for preferred monitoring frequency   

## Prerequisites
OpenAI API key, competitor data source API access, vendor monitoring service credentials 

## Use Cases
SaaS companies tracking competitor feature releases and pricing changes 

## Customization
Modify risk scoring formulas in Calculator nodes for industry-specific metrics 

## Benefits
Transforms hours of manual competitor research into automated minutes-long cycles

workflow.name: Detect and correct claims cost leakage using AI analysis and automation

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert claims cost leakage analyst specializing in insurance fraud detection and billing accuracy.

Your task is to analyze detected cost leakage anomalies and classify the root cause into one of these categories:

1. EXCESSIVE_PAYOUT - Payment exceeds reasonable limits for claim type
2. INCONSISTENT_RESERVE - Reserve amount significantly differs from actual payout
3. DUPLICATE_BILLING - Same service/item billed multiple times
4. INFLATED_CHARGES - Vendor charges exceed market rates
5. CODING_ERROR - Incorrect billing codes or modifiers
6. POLICY_VIOLATION - Payment violates policy terms or coverage limits
7. FRAUD_SUSPECTED - Pattern indicates potential fraudulent activity
8. ADMINISTRATIVE_ERROR - Processing or data entry mistake

For each anomaly, provide:
- Root cause category
- Confidence score (0-100)
- Detailed explanation
- Contributing factors
- Severity level (LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, CRITICAL)

Return your analysis in the structured JSON format defined by the output parser.

parameters.html:
=

Claims Cost Leakage Detection Report

Report Date: {{ $today.toFormat('yyyy-MM-dd') }}

Executive Summary

This report contains detected cost leakages, AI-powered root cause classifications, and recommended corrective adjustments.

Total Estimated Leakage Amount

${{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.totalLeakageAmount }}

Breakdown by Severity Level

  • High Severity: {{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.highSeverityCount }} cases - ${{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.highSeverityAmount }}
  • Medium Severity: {{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.mediumSeverityCount }} cases - ${{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.mediumSeverityAmount }}
  • Low Severity: {{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.lowSeverityCount }} cases - ${{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.lowSeverityAmount }}

Detected Leakages

{{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.leakageSummary }}

AI Root Cause Classifications

{{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.aiClassifications }}

Corrective Adjustments

{{ $('Aggregate Findings Report').first().json.correctiveAdjustments }}

This report was generated automatically by the Enterprise Claims Cost Leakage Detection system.
parameters.subject: =Claims Cost Leakage Detection Report - {{ $today.toFormat('yyyy-MM-dd') }}

parameters.query: SELECT COUNT(*) as pattern_count, AVG(leakage_amount) as avg_amount FROM claim_leakage_history WHERE claim_id = $1 OR vendor_id = $2 AND detected_date > NOW() - INTERVAL '90 days'

parameters.html:
=

üö® URGENT: Critical Claims Leakage Alert

Alert Generated: {{ $now.toFormat('yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss') }}

Critical Leakage Details

  • Claim ID: {{ $json.claim_id }}
  • Leakage Amount: ${{ $json.adjustment_amount }}
  • Root Cause: {{ $json.root_cause }}
  • Confidence Score: {{ $json.confidence_score }}%
  • Priority Level: {{ $json.priority_level }}

Recommended Immediate Actions

  1. {{ $json.recommended_action }}
  2. Review claim documentation and supporting evidence
  3. Contact vendor/provider for clarification if applicable
  4. Initiate corrective adjustment process
  5. Document findings in claims management system

Justification

{{ $json.justification }}

This is an automated escalation alert. Please respond within 24 hours.
parameters.subject: URGENT: Critical Claims Leakage Detected - Immediate Action Required

parameters.content:
## How It Works
This workflow automates enterprise claims cost leakage detection by identifying overpayments, policy deviations, and pricing inconsistencies across claims data. It supports claims operations, finance, and audit teams by providing continuous, AI-driven monitoring without manual review. Claims data is ingested through parallel HTTP requests, including claim history, policy details, pricing rules, and enrichment data. Historical claim patterns feed calculator-based risk scoring to flag potential leakage scenarios. All data streams are consolidated and analyzed using GPT-4 with structured outputs to detect anomalies, quantify leakage risk, and recommend corrective adjustments. The workflow generates claim-level findings and routes outcomes by severity: high-risk leakage triggers immediate email and Slack alerts, while lower-risk issues are compiled into periodic audit and recovery reports.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure HTTP nodes with competitor website APIs  
2. Add OpenAI API key to Chat Model node for AI analysis  
3. Connect Gmail account and set leadership distribution list  
4. Integrate Slack workspace and configure strategy team  
5. Adjust Schedule node timing for preferred monitoring frequency

## Prerequisites
OpenAI API key, competitor data source API access, vendor monitoring service credentials 

## Use Cases
SaaS companies tracking competitor feature releases and pricing changes 

## Customization
Modify risk scoring formulas in Calculator nodes for industry-specific metrics 

## Benefits
Transforms hours of manual competitor research into automated minutes-long cycles

## **Severity-Based Routing**
High-severity findings trigger immediate Gmail and Slack alerts

## **Conditional Risk Scoring and AI Analysis**
Historical checks trigger risk scoring, and all intelligence is merged for GPT-4 analysis

## **Parallel Data Collection**
HTTP nodes fetch vendor history, enrichment data, and policy rules, while batch processing detects cost anomalies across competitors.

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
